channel.title: BBC News - UK

item.title: Brexit: No better outcome than my deal, says Johnson
item.description: Boris Johnson makes a fresh appeal to MPs ahead of Saturday's knife-edge Commons vote on his Brexit deal.

item.title: Court of Session dismisses bid to stop 'illegal' Brexit deal
item.description: Lord Pentland ruled the application by Remain campaigners was "misconceived and unjustified".

item.title: Dad who raped daughters given 40-year term at Swansea Crown Court
item.description: The man from south west Wales fathered at least six children with one of his daughters.

item.title: Becoming a mother has been 'struggle', Meghan says
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex tells ITV of being under the spotlight "on top of just trying to be a new mom".

item.title: BonmarchÃ© appoints administrators
item.description: The chain's 318 shops will remain open while a buyer is sought for the business.

item.title: Wedding caterers fined for salmonella-infected hog roast
item.description: Fifty-eight guests fell ill after eating the contaminated meat at Vicki and Phil Kemp's reception.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion: Central London targeted despite ban
item.description: Protesters take to Oxford Circus, Whitehall and Trafalgar Square to demand action on climate change.

item.title: Maids Moreton: Ben Field jailed for author's murder
item.description: Benjamin Field, 28, seduced 69-year-old Peter Farquhar into changing his will before killing him.

item.title: Tate Modern fall: Boy, 6, 'out of intensive care'
item.description: The six-year-old boy is in a rehabilitation centre with splints keeping some of his limbs in place.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Parents ask police to charge crash death suspect
item.description: Harry Dunn's family say US officials are "ruthlessly" protecting Anne Sacoolas from facing justice.

item.title: Baby Niamh Williams' wait for Cardiff hospital bed 'horrific'
item.description: Niamh Williams has been waiting for a specialised assessment since her birth on 1 October.

item.title: Brexit: What to expect from Parliament's Saturday sitting
item.description: The weekend sitting of Parliament will see MPs vote on Boris Johnson's Brexit deal.

item.title: Legal bid at Court of Session to stop MPs passing 'illegal' Brexit deal
item.description: Anti-Brexit campaigner Jo Maugham has lodged a petition at Scotland's highest civil court.

item.title: Brexit deal: What does it mean?
item.description: Boris Johnson has agreed a new Brexit deal with the EU - but what does it mean and will Parliament pass it?

item.title: Brexit deal: Where have the UK and EU compromised?
item.description: After tense negotiations, both sides made concessions to reach a new deal.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Parents' grief on hold after US trip
item.description: BBC journalist Duncan Kennedy reflects on a harrowing trip for Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn.

item.title: Boris Johnson, Jennifer Arcuri, and the mysterious Annie Tacker
item.description: Questions surround Boris Johnson's friendship with Jennifer Arcuri, including her UK media manager.

item.title: Autism: Strangers help Abertillery girl celebrate birthday
item.description: The father of a five-year-old girl thanks those who responded to a plea after friends failed to show.

item.title: Motorbiking to Everest: Landslides, monsoons and altitude
item.description: The first all-female motorcycling group have reached Everest base camp - but it was far from easy.

item.title: Gerry Adams: A past that hasn't gone away
item.description: How a case about a 1972 murder led to questions about Gerry Adams' past in a Belfast courtroom.

item.title: Channel 4 move makes Leeds the new media city
item.description: The broadcaster opens a new "national HQ" to better reflect life across Britain.

item.title: The man who owns 1,000 meteorites
item.description: Graham Ensor says finding rocks that have travelled billions of miles "is an incredible feeling".

item.title: Harry Dunn death: Is extraditing Anne Sacoolas a realistic prospect?
item.description: What are the legal options that might provide Harry Dunn's parents with the details of his death?

item.title: What impact will US tariffs have on Scotch whisky?
item.description: The whisky, shortbread and cashmere industries explain how the new 25% tariff could affect their business.

item.title: In full: Laura Kuenssberg grills Johnson on Brexit deal
item.description: The prime minister urges MPs to "come together" and vote for his Brexit deal on Saturday.

item.title: Brexit: Crunching the numbers on key MPs' vote on Johnson's new deal
item.description: The House of Commons will sit on Saturday to vote on the new Brexit deal proposed by Boris Johnson.

item.title: Boris Johnson's new Brexit deal - will MPs support it?
item.description: With an agreement reached with the EU, Boris Johnson now needs MPs to back it in Parliament.

item.title: New Brexit deal: Four ways it's different, one way it's the same
item.description: Brussels correspondent Adam Fleming compares Boris Johnson's withdrawal agreement with Theresa May's.

item.title: BBC's Joanna Gosling slips up over Sex and the City star name
item.description: BBC presenter Joanna Gosling corrected herself after mistakenly calling her colleague by a celebrity name.

item.title: Brexit: What is the DUP and what does it believe in?
item.description: The BBC's Jayne McCormack explains why the Democratic Unionist Party has so much power.

item.title: Husband Shaun May told wife to shut eyes and expect gift
item.description: Shaun May left his wife in bed with her eyes closed as he fetched a kitchen knife, police say.

item.title: Scottish department store Watt Brothers goes into administration
item.description: Administrators have made 229 of the company's 306 employees redundant with immediate effect.

item.title: Brexit: DUP 'encouraging' Tory MPs to reject deal
item.description: The party's Brexit spokesperson says it wants Conservatives to "take a stand" in Saturday's vote.

item.title: Herald editor Tom Sinclair confirms newspaper closures
item.description: A newspaper editor who owed thousands of pounds to former staff, confirms the group has closed.

item.title: Yousef Makki inquest adjourned over ambulance delay
item.description: A security guard reviewed CCTV footage and contacted Yousef Makki's family, an inquest hears.
